```{r import_data, results = 'hide'}
## boundary for San Francisco

  clean_names() %>%
  filter(name == "San Francisco") %>%
```


```{r map, layout = "l-page", fig.height = 8}
resource_groups <- unique(food_resources$category)

map <- 
  leaflet() %>% 
  addProviderTiles(provider = providers$CartoDB.Positron) %>%
  addPolygons(data = demographics, group = "Demographics", fillColor = ~demo_pal(pct_api_clean), color = gray, weight = 1, fillOpacity = .8) %>%
  
  # legends
  
  addLegend(position = "bottomright", pal = demo_pal, values = demographics$pct_api_clean, opacity = .8, title = "% Asian or Pacific Islander<br>ACS 2019 (5-year)", group = "Neighborhood Demographics") 


# use walk from per to return m after adding each layer
resource_groups %>%                     # get names of resource groups
  walk(function(x)                         # then walk through vector of names one at a time
    map <<- 
      map %>% 
      addCircles(data = food_resources %>% filter(category == x),
                 radius = 3,
                 group = x,
                 color = gray,
                 opacity = .8,
                 popup = ~popup,
                 labelOptions = labelOptions(
                   style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px", "color" = gray),
                   textsize = "15px",
                   direction = "auto")))

map <- 
  map %>% 
  addLayersControl(
    overlayGroups = c("Neighborhood Demographics", resource_groups),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE)
  ) %>%
  hideGroup("Demographics")


map


```
